author: hkalodner
content: Can confirm, currently for pricing standard calldata batches we use the base fee rather than the full fee paid and would do the same for blobs semantically though as you say, there's no difference currently. Using the gas price would open up attacks such as paying a large tip to the block producer which is reimbursed back to the sequencer offline while L2 users also get charged for the fee. So far it's been safe to assume that the priority fee is small relative to the base fee on average over time

author: peter.davies
content: Currently there is a large queue of deposits (roughly 11 days worth remaining) that has been there for ages. Someone submitted a large batch of exits, which resulted in the exit queue also filling. While both queues are full, 12 entries and 12 exits will be processed each epoch (32 blocks) resulting in a flat line. When the exit queue empties the exits will stop and the line start rising again.

author: peter.davies
content: Deposits get added to the queue in batches every twelve hours due to the Eth1Data voting mechanism. The last batch landed about 5 hours ago.
